oai_dc:dc.dc:descriptions: The crying of the Wind tells the beasts of prey where to find people, and when it blows strongly they can approach the dwelling unheard, etc. (L V.-23. 5846-5857).
People must hide when the wind blows strongly, as it means that the lion is coming for them and the blowing hides the sound of its approach from the dogs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The crying of the wind tells beasts of prey where to find people
